ru.spbu.math.ais.dao.impls

Class StatsDAOImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.spbu.math.ais.dao.impls.StatsDAOImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StatsDAO

    @Repository
public class StatsDAOImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements StatsDAO
    Author:
    vlad
    Hibernate-based implementation of StatsDAO @see StatsDAO
    Implementation provides basic methods to retrieve observations and calculate several basic statistics upon Directors and Storage Groups.
    Implementation defines a "problematic" director/storage group in terms of special coefficients(thresholds).
    Those thresholds are then used to compare entities' states with "normal" states (it is assumed that . The thresholds may be set by user in application configuration file (namely 'appConfig.properties').

    • Method Detail

      • getProlematicDirectors

        @Transactional
public java.util.List<Director> getProlematicDirectors()
        Returns list of problematic directors based on director's queue values. Queue of a director is divided into several buckets(enumerated). The most important are 7th, 8th and 9th buckets (big deviations from 0 indicates overloaded director). Therefore, a director D is considered to be problematic if the following predicate is true for director:
        (B7(D) > AVG7 * D_COEFFICIENT7 ) &&
        (B8(D) > AVG8 * D_COEFFICIENT8) &&
        (B9(D) > AVG9 * D_COEFFICIENT9)

        where Bi(D) returns number of requests standing in i-th bucket of queue. AVGi is an average of Bi for all directors.
        Coefficients D_COEFFICIENT_9, D_COEFFICIENT_8, D_COEFFICIENT_7 have default values (100.0, 50.0, 10.0) but may be overridden by in appConfig.properties by properties:
        director.problematic.C7, director.problematic.C8, director.problematic.C9 respectively.
        Specified by:
        getProlematicDirectors in interface StatsDAO
        Returns:
        list of "problematic" directors

      • getProblematicStorageGroups

        @Transactional
public java.util.List<StorageGroup> getProblematicStorageGroups()
        Returns list of problematic storage groups(abbreviated to 'SG' further) based on SG's response times. An SG has queue buckets for each of which write and read response times are calculated. The most remarkable buckets are 5th, 6th, 7th ones. Therefore, an SG S is considered to be problematic if the following predicate is true for S:
        ( BW5(S) + BR5(S) > (AVGW5 + AVGR5) * SG_COFFICIENT5 ) &&
        ( BW6(S) + BR6(S) > (AVGW6 + AVGR6) * SG_COFFICIENT6 ) &&
        ( BW7(S) + BR7(S) > (AVGW7 + AVGR7) * SG_COFFICIENT7 )

        where BWi(S) and BRi(S) return response times of a write and read I/O requests standing in i-th bucket respectively. AVGWi (AVGRi) is an average of BWi and BRi for all SGs respectively.
        Coefficients SG_COEFFICIENT7, SG_COEFFICIENT6, SG_COEFFICIENT5 have default values (100.0, 50.0, 10.0) but may be overridden in appConfig.properties by properties:
        sg.problematic.G7, sg.problematic.G6, sg.problematic.G5 respectively.
        Specified by:
        getProblematicStorageGroups in interface StatsDAO
        Returns:
        list of "problematic" storageGroups

      • getDirectorAndSGProblemLinks

        @Transactional
public java.util.List<ProblemLink> getDirectorAndSGProblemLinks(java.lang.Integer directorId)
        Establishes potential casual relationship between bad states of storage groups and specified director
        A link between a director and a storage group is established if at the time when a director can be called "problematic" the storage groups is also "problematic".
